original: @201b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @201b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: shta aam ga yo ga n'a ma t'i ka //
analyzed: shta aam ga yo ga n'a ma t'i ka //
translated: ·π¢a·∏ça·πÖgayoga-nƒÅma-tƒ´kƒÅ

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: sbyor ba yan lag drug pa zhes bya ba'i 'grel pa /
analyzed: sbyor ba yan lag drug pa zhes bya ba'i 'grel pa /
translated: The Commentary Called ‚ÄúThe Six-Limbed Yoga‚Äù

original: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to glorious Vajrasattva.

original: dbang po rnams dang dbang po rnams kyi yul gnyi ga'i dbang po ste /
analyzed: dbang po rnams dang dbang po rnams kyi yul gnyi ga'i dbang po ste /
translated: The sense faculties and the objects of the sense faculties are both faculties.

original: dbang po bcu po yul dang yul can de rnams kyi rang gi 'jug pa ni /
analyzed: dbang po bcu po yul dang yul can de rnams kyi rang gi 'jug pa ni /
translated: The engagement of those ten faculties, as subjects and objects,

original: ji ltar rang nyid kyi gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gyis 'jug pa ni rang gi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rang nyid kyi gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gyis 'jug pa ni rang gi 'jug pa'o //
translated: is their own engagement, in the sense that they engage through their own nature as perceivers and the perceived.

original: der gnas pas na rang gi 'jug pa gnas so //
analyzed: der gnas pas na rang gi 'jug pa gnas so //
translated: Since they abide in that, they abide in their own engagement.

original: thams cad du dman pa dang / bar ma dang / mchog gi bye brag gis so //
analyzed: thams cad du dman pa dang / bar ma dang / mchog gi bye brag gis so //
translated: In all cases, there are distinctions of inferior, middling, and superior.

original: 'dod pa so sor sdud pas na //
analyzed: 'dod pa so sor sdud pas na //
translated: By individually withdrawing the desires,

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dod cing chags par bya ba yin pas na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dod cing chags par bya ba yin pas na /
translated: means that since they are to be desired and attached to,

original: 'dod pa ste gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa ste gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: they are desires, such as forms and so on.

original: de rnams la ni dbang po rnams kyis gang so sor yang dang yang du sdud cing len pas na sdud pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de rnams la ni dbang po rnams kyis gang so sor yang dang yang du sdud cing len pas na sdud pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Since those are repeatedly gathered and taken up by the individual faculties, they are called ‚Äúgathering.‚Äù

original: yan lag dang po'i bshad pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag dang po'i bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the first branch.

original: so sor sdud pa rnam par sbyang bar bya ba'i don du yan lag gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir 'dod pa lnga ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: so sor sdud pa rnam par sbyang bar bya ba'i don du yan lag gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir 'dod pa lnga ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to purify the individual gatherings, the second branch is taught.

original: 'dod pa lnga ni dbang po lnga'i yul du gyur pa gzugs la sogs pa ni mdor bsdus nas te /
analyzed: 'dod pa lnga ni dbang po lnga'i yul du gyur pa gzugs la sogs pa ni mdor bsdus nas te /
translated: The five desires are the objects of the five faculties, such as form, and so on, in brief.

original: dbang po rnams dang gcig tu gyur nas so //
analyzed: dbang po rnams dang gcig tu gyur nas so //
translated: Having become one with the faculties,

original: sangs rgyas lnga ni mig la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas lnga ni mig la sogs pa ste /
translated: the five buddhas are the eyes, and so on.

original: de rnams kyi sbyor ba ni yang dag par sbyor bas sangs rgyas lnga ru sbyor ba yin te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi sbyor ba ni yang dag par sbyor bas sangs rgyas lnga ru sbyor ba yin te /
translated: Since they are united with the application of those, they are united with the five buddhas.

original: de bas na gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyang sangs rgyas yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyang sangs rgyas yin no //
translated: Therefore, form, and so on, are also buddhas.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i yongs su dag pa'i brtag pa de nyid bsam gtan zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i yongs su dag pa'i brtag pa de nyid bsam gtan zhes bshad do //
translated: That very pure imagination that has become that is explained as concentration.

original: de yang rtog pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa lngar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang rtog pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa lngar 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, it becomes fivefold by the division of conceptualization, etc.

original: rtog pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de'i dbye ba bshad pa'o //üîΩdbang po dang / @202a * //
analyzed: rtog pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de'i dbye ba bshad pa'o // dbang po dang / @202a * //
translated: Conceptualization, etc. explain its division.üîΩThe three secrets are the sense faculty,

original: yul dang / dbang po'i shes pa ni gsang ba gsum ste /
analyzed: yul dang / dbang po'i shes pa ni gsang ba gsum ste /
translated: the object, and the sense consciousness.

original: dbang po lnga dang / dbang po'i shes pa dang / de'i yul rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnam pa lnga'i bdag nyid yin no zhes gang rtog pa de ni rtog pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po lnga dang / dbang po'i shes pa dang / de'i yul rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnam pa lnga'i bdag nyid yin no zhes gang rtog pa de ni rtog pa'o //
translated: Conceptualization is the thought that the five sense faculties, the sense consciousnesses, and their objects are the nature of the five tathƒÅgatas.

original: de nyid la rnam par dpyod pa ni gnas pa la spyod pa'o //üîΩde ltar dpyad nas de kho na nyid la 'jug pa la mngon par phyogs pas gang yid la bde ba'i mtshan nyid can de nyid dga' ba la reg pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid la rnam par dpyod pa ni gnas pa la spyod pa'o // de ltar dpyad nas de kho na nyid la 'jug pa la mngon par phyogs pas gang yid la bde ba'i mtshan nyid can de nyid dga' ba la reg pa'o //
translated: Abiding in that is engaging in the abode.üîΩHaving analyzed in that way, since one is inclined toward entering suchness, the characteristic of mental bliss is the contact of joy.

original: de kho na nyid la mngon par zhugs pas lus shin tu sbyangs pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi bde ba gang thob pa de ni bde bas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid la mngon par zhugs pas lus shin tu sbyangs pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi bde ba gang thob pa de ni bde bas bsdus pa'o //
translated: The attainment of bliss that has the characteristic of physical pliancy, etc., by engaging in suchness is the bliss that is subsumed.

original: de ltar sbyangs pa las rab kyi mthar thug par son pa'i phyir shes pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar sbyangs pa las rab kyi mthar thug par son pa'i phyir shes pa ste /
translated: Thus, because of having reached the ultimate perfection of training, it is knowledge.

original: mig la sogs pa drug gi 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang shes bya ste /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa drug gi 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang shes bya ste /
translated: The arising of the six consciousnesses that engage the eye, etc., and of the objects of knowledge,

original: gzugs la sogs pa nas chos kyi khams kyi bar du 'byung ba ni shes pa dang shes bya byung ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa nas chos kyi khams kyi bar du 'byung ba ni shes pa dang shes bya byung ba'o //
translated: from form, etc., up to the element of mental objects, is the arising of knowledge and objects of knowledge.

original: de'i zad pa ni sems kyi gzung ba dang 'dzin pa stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: de'i zad pa ni sems kyi gzung ba dang 'dzin pa stong pa nyid de /
translated: The exhaustion of that is the emptiness of the mind's subject and object.

original: de bas na ye shes kyi mtshan nyid can gyi sems rtse gcig pa la ni rang sems zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na ye shes kyi mtshan nyid can gyi sems rtse gcig pa la ni rang sems zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the one-pointed mind that has the characteristic of pristine awareness is called one's own mind.

original: de lta bu'i sems de ni sangs rgyas kun dngos zhi ba ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i sems de ni sangs rgyas kun dngos zhi ba ste /
translated: That mind is the peace that is the actuality of all buddhas.

original: snang ba tsam dang thams cad stong par gcig tu mthar thug par 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: snang ba tsam dang thams cad stong par gcig tu mthar thug par 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: It arises as the ultimate unity of mere appearance and complete emptiness.

original: yan lag gnyis pa'i dbye ba rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: yan lag gnyis pa'i dbye ba rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: The five aspects of the division of the second branch are

original: ye shes lnga'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin gyis dbu gas te /
analyzed: ye shes lnga'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin gyis dbu gas te /
translated: the five pristine awarenesses, etc. The head is split open by the nature of the five pristine awarenesses.

original: yang de nyid sa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du rang gi rdo rje'i bu gnas byung nas padma'i sna'i rtse mor gong bu'i gzugs kyis te /
analyzed: yang de nyid sa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du rang gi rdo rje'i bu gnas byung nas padma'i sna'i rtse mor gong bu'i gzugs kyis te /
translated: Again, that very [wind] arises in the form of a drop at the tip of the nose of the lotus, having come out of one's vajra.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le'i gzugs kyis bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le'i gzugs kyis bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on it in the form of a drop of bodhicitta.

original: de nyid gyen du 'gro ba'i dbugs ni kha dog sna lnga pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid gyen du 'gro ba'i dbugs ni kha dog sna lnga pa ste /
translated: That very [wind] moving upward is five-colored,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: having the nature of the five TathƒÅgatas.

original: de nyid kyis na rin po che'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na rin po che'o //
translated: Therefore, it is a jewel.

original: srog ni 'tsho ba'o //
analyzed: srog ni 'tsho ba'o //
translated: Life is living.

original: rtsol zhing ring du spros pa gang yin pa de ni srog dang rtsol pa zhes byar bshad ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: rtsol zhing ring du spros pa gang yin pa de ni srog dang rtsol pa zhes byar bshad ces bya ba ste /
translated: That which is effort and is extended is explained as life and effort.

original: de nyid du 'jug pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis nyin dang mtshan du zlos par gyur pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrang sngags snying gar bsams te /
analyzed: de nyid du 'jug pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis nyin dang mtshan du zlos par gyur pa'i phyir ro // rang sngags snying gar bsams te /
translated: Because it is repeated day and night by the nature of entering and so forth into that very [wind].üîΩHaving visualized one's mantra at the heart,

original: rang gi snying ga'i padma la bsams nas /
analyzed: rang gi snying ga'i padma la bsams nas /
translated: having visualized it on the lotus of one's heart,

original: srog ni thig ler gyur par bzhag / ces bya ba mi shigs pa gtogs @202b par dgod pa ste yan lag gsum pa'o //
analyzed: srog ni thig ler gyur par bzhag / ces bya ba mi shigs pa gtogs @202b par dgod pa ste yan lag gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third branch, the placement of the indestructible.

original: rang gi gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: One‚Äôs own form and so on.

original: dbang po ni mig la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po ni mig la sogs pa ste /
translated: The faculties are the eye and so on.

original: de la dbang po gnyis dgag cing nges par thim nas de'i 'og tu yul dang dbang po'i rten du gyur pa'i rin po che ste /
analyzed: de la dbang po gnyis dgag cing nges par thim nas de'i 'og tu yul dang dbang po'i rten du gyur pa'i rin po che ste /
translated: There, having blocked the two faculties and dissolved them, then after that, the jewel which is the support of the object and the faculty,

original: sems kyi rin po che srog dang rtsol ba dang bcas par bkag cing nub par gyur pa'i gzung ba gang yin pa de 'dzin pa yin par bshad de /
analyzed: sems kyi rin po che srog dang rtsol ba dang bcas par bkag cing nub par gyur pa'i gzung ba gang yin pa de 'dzin pa yin par bshad de /
translated: the life force and the exertion, the drop, having been blocked and set, the object is explained as the subject.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The limit of reality.

original: sems ni 'gog pa'i rdo rjer 'gyur //
analyzed: sems ni 'gog pa'i rdo rjer 'gyur //
translated: The mind becomes the vajra of cessation.

original: mtshan ma nyer 'dzin 'byung par 'gyur //
analyzed: mtshan ma nyer 'dzin 'byung par 'gyur //
translated: The sign is apprehended as an element.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: There,

original: 'gog pa'i rdo rje ni 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i rdo rje ni 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: the vajra of cessation is clear light.

original: der gyur pa ni sems der gyur ba'o //
analyzed: der gyur pa ni sems der gyur ba'o //
translated: Having become that, the mind becomes that.

original: mtshan ma rnams kyi nye bar 'dzin pa na mtshan mar nyer 'dzin te /
analyzed: mtshan ma rnams kyi nye bar 'dzin pa na mtshan mar nyer 'dzin te /
translated: When one grasps the signs, one grasps the signs as existent.

original: mtshan mar snang ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan mar snang ba'o //
translated: The signs appear.

original: 'byung bar gyur pa ni skye bar gyur pa'i //
analyzed: 'byung bar gyur pa ni skye bar gyur pa'i //
translated: The arising is the arising of the signs.

original: mtshan ma'i khams ni rnam pa lngar //
analyzed: mtshan ma'i khams ni rnam pa lngar //
translated: The sign-source is fivefold.

original: byang chub rdo rje gsungs pa yin //
analyzed: byang chub rdo rje gsungs pa yin //
translated: It is taught by Vajra of Awakening.

original: zhes bya ba ni sa chu la thim par gyur pa las smig rgyu dang 'dra bar snang bar gyur pa ni mtshan ma dang po'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sa chu la thim par gyur pa las smig rgyu dang 'dra bar snang bar gyur pa ni mtshan ma dang po'o //
translated: The first sign is the appearance like a mirage, which occurs when the earth dissolves into water.

original: de bzhin du chu me la thim par gyur pa las du ba lta bu ste gnyis pa'o //üîΩme rlung la thim par gyur pa las /üîΩnam mkha' snang bar gyur pa lta bu ste gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du chu me la thim par gyur pa las du ba lta bu ste gnyis pa'o // me rlung la thim par gyur pa las / nam mkha' snang bar gyur pa lta bu ste gsum pa'o //
translated: The second sign is the appearance like smoke, which occurs when water dissolves into fire.üîΩThe third sign is the appearance like fireflies, which occurs when fire dissolves into air.

original: khams phra ba kun du snang ba gsum du song ba las mar me ltar snang ba'i tshogs kyi ngo bo nyid ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: khams phra ba kun du snang ba gsum du song ba las mar me ltar snang ba'i tshogs kyi ngo bo nyid ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth sign is the appearance like a burning lamp, which occurs when air dissolves into space.üîΩThe fifth sign is the appearance like the sky, which occurs when the three subtle elements have dissolved into the consciousness element.

original: rang bzhin kun du snang ba la thim par gyur pa las sprin med pa'i nam mkha' dang 'dra zhing rtag tu snang ba 'od gsal ba tsam du gyur pa ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin kun du snang ba la thim par gyur pa las sprin med pa'i nam mkha' dang 'dra zhing rtag tu snang ba 'od gsal ba tsam du gyur pa ni lnga pa'o //
translated: The fifth is when the appearance of the nature dissolves into the all-ground, and it becomes like a cloudless sky, always appearing as just luminosity.

original: mtshan ma lnga po de dag gis mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma lnga po de dag gis mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Through these five signs, one attains nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: de yang ji skad du las kyi mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las /üîΩdang pos ni chu la thim //
analyzed: de yang ji skad du las kyi mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las / dang pos ni chu la thim //
translated: As the Analysis of Karma says:üîΩThe first dissolves into water.

original: chu yang me la thim par gyur //
analyzed: chu yang me la thim par gyur //
translated: Water dissolves into fire.

original: me ni rlung la thim 'gyur zhing //üîΩrlung yang rnam par shes la 'jug / rnam shes gzung ba de nyid ni //
analyzed: me ni rlung la thim 'gyur zhing // rlung yang rnam par shes la 'jug / rnam shes gzung ba de nyid ni //
translated: Fire dissolves into wind.üîΩWind enters into consciousness.

original: 'od gsal par yang 'jug pa yin //üîΩzhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: 'od gsal par yang 'jug pa yin // zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: That consciousness enters into luminosity.

original: brtan par gyur cing rnam par dag bar gyur nas /
analyzed: brtan par gyur cing rnam par dag bar gyur nas /
translated: When one becomes stable and pure,

original: rdo rje'i lam nas 'da' bar mi bya ba'i mtshan ma lnga'i rim gyis 'od gsal bar 'jug pas nam mkha'i khams te /
analyzed: rdo rje'i lam nas 'da' bar mi bya ba'i mtshan ma lnga'i rim gyis 'od gsal bar 'jug pas nam mkha'i khams te /
translated: one enters luminosity through the five signs that one should not pass beyond the vajra path.üîΩThe space element is the all-ground.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams su spro bar bya zhing chos kyi sku'i tshul gyis khyab par bya'o//
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams su spro bar bya zhing chos kyi sku'i tshul gyis khyab par bya'o//
translated: One should radiate them into the world-realms and pervade them with the mode of the Dharma Body.

original: @203a * // de dag ni 'dzin pa'i yan lag ces bya ba ste bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: @203a * // de dag ni 'dzin pa'i yan lag ces bya ba ste bzhi pa'o //
translated: These are called the branch of retention, the fourth.

original: de ltar bdag nyid 'od gsal bar song bar rnam par bsgom zhing mngon sum du byas nas /üîΩgang sngon rjes su dran pa smig rgyu 'dra ba la sogs pa'i rnam pas yang dag pa'i mtha' thob pa de dang 'dra zhing /
analyzed: de ltar bdag nyid 'od gsal bar song bar rnam par bsgom zhing mngon sum du byas nas / gang sngon rjes su dran pa smig rgyu 'dra ba la sogs pa'i rnam pas yang dag pa'i mtha' thob pa de dang 'dra zhing /
translated: Having thus contemplated and actualized oneself as having gone to the state of clear light,

original: de nyid kyi rim pas spro bar bya zhing bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi rim pas spro bar bya zhing bskyed par bya ste /
translated: one should radiate and generate the same as before, in the manner of the recollection of the mirage and so forth, which is the attainment of the limit of reality.

original: bshad ma thag pa de dag ni rjes su dran pa zhes bshad pa yin par shes shing khong du chad par bya'o //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa de dag ni rjes su dran pa zhes bshad pa yin par shes shing khong du chad par bya'o //
translated: One should understand and comprehend that these just explained are called the branch of recollection.

original: so sor snang ba de las skye //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: so sor snang ba de las skye // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The branch of meditative concentration arises from the appearance of each.

original: so sor snang ba ni yang dag par rig pa ste /
analyzed: so sor snang ba ni yang dag par rig pa ste /
translated: The appearance of each is the correct understanding.

original: de las rjes su dran pa'i yan lag skye bar 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de las rjes su dran pa'i yan lag skye bar 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: The branch of recollection arises from that, not from anything else.

original: thabs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: thabs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The method and wisdom are the union.

original: thabs dang shes ba snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: thabs dang shes ba snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
translated: The method and wisdom are the union.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa'i sbyor bas dngos pa thams cad de rgyu ba dang / mi rgyu ba la gnas pa gong bu'i tshul gyis te /
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa'i sbyor bas dngos pa thams cad de rgyu ba dang / mi rgyu ba la gnas pa gong bu'i tshul gyis te /
translated: By the union of the conventional and ultimate truths, all things, that is, the animate and inanimate, are gathered into a single whole.

original: phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs kyis gcig tu byas nas rgyu ba dang / mi rgyu ba de'i dbus su zung du 'jug pa'i bdag nyid can rdo rje 'chang chen po'i gzugs rnam par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs kyis gcig tu byas nas rgyu ba dang / mi rgyu ba de'i dbus su zung du 'jug pa'i bdag nyid can rdo rje 'chang chen po'i gzugs rnam par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Having made the animate and inanimate into a single whole in the form of the great seal, one should visualize the form of Great Vajradhara, whose nature is the union, in the middle of that.

original: rim pa 'di nyid kyis yud kyi zhes pa ste /
analyzed: rim pa 'di nyid kyis yud kyi zhes pa ste /
translated: By this very process, in an instant,

original: skad cig tsam gyis so //
analyzed: skad cig tsam gyis so //
translated: in just a moment,

original: ye shes rdzogs par byed pa zhes pa ste /
analyzed: ye shes rdzogs par byed pa zhes pa ste /
translated: one should perfect the exalted wisdom.

original: ye shes kyi sku rdzogs par byed pa ni ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: ye shes kyi sku rdzogs par byed pa ni ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: The perfection of the exalted wisdom body is the concentration.

original: yan lag drug pa yin bar bshad do //
analyzed: yan lag drug pa yin bar bshad do //
translated: This is explained as the sixth branch.

original: dpal sgyu 'phrul dra ba las kyang lha bskyed pa'i dbye ba 'di nyid gsal bar gsungs te /
analyzed: dpal sgyu 'phrul dra ba las kyang lha bskyed pa'i dbye ba 'di nyid gsal bar gsungs te /
translated: This very division of the generation of the deity is clearly taught in the glorious Magical Net.

original: rnal 'byor rnam gsum shes bya ste //
analyzed: rnal 'byor rnam gsum shes bya ste //
translated: One should know the three kinds of yoga:

original: byin gyis brlabs dang yongs brtag dang // gzugs nyid yongs su rdzogs pa ste//
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs dang yongs brtag dang // gzugs nyid yongs su rdzogs pa ste//
translated: Empowerment, thorough examination, and the complete form.

original: rnal 'byor sangs rgyas rnams kyi bsngags //
analyzed: rnal 'byor sangs rgyas rnams kyi bsngags //
translated: The buddhas praise these yogas.

original: sngags kyis byin brlabs nga rgyal bskyed //
analyzed: sngags kyis byin brlabs nga rgyal bskyed //
translated: Empowerment by mantra generates pride.

original: rnal 'byor byin rlabs yin par gsungs //
analyzed: rnal 'byor byin rlabs yin par gsungs //
translated: This is said to be the yoga of empowerment.

original: byang chub sems ni dag pa dang // gsang sngags sa bon skye ba che //
analyzed: byang chub sems ni dag pa dang // gsang sngags sa bon skye ba che //
translated: The pure mind of enlightenment and the seed of mantra are the great birth.

original: phyag rgya'i tshogs su brtag pa yis //
analyzed: phyag rgya'i tshogs su brtag pa yis //
translated: The assembly of seals is thoroughly examined.

original: rim gyis gzugs ni rdzogs byas pa //
analyzed: rim gyis gzugs ni rdzogs byas pa //
translated: The form is gradually completed.

original: de ni brtag par brjod pa ste //
analyzed: de ni brtag par brjod pa ste //
translated: This is said to be the thorough examination.

original: rnal 'byor cho ga yin par gsungs //
analyzed: rnal 'byor cho ga yin par gsungs //
translated: This is said to be the ritual of yoga.

original: sdud dang spro bar byas pa las //
analyzed: sdud dang spro bar byas pa las //
translated: From the emanation and gatheringüîΩof all the supreme aspects,

original: rnam pa'i mchog kun ldan pa dag / skad cig ye shes kyis rdzogs pa //
analyzed: rnam pa'i mchog kun ldan pa dag / skad cig ye shes kyis rdzogs pa //
translated: the complete form is perfected in an instant of wisdom.

original: rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor zhes bshad do //
translated: This is explained to be the perfect yoga.

original: zhes bya ba dang / rnam par @203b snang mdzad mngon par byang chub pa las kyang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / rnam par @203b snang mdzad mngon par byang chub pa las kyang /
translated: And in the Enlightenment of Vairocana Tantra it says:

original: lha'i rnal 'byor pa rnam pa gnyis ston te /
analyzed: lha'i rnal 'byor pa rnam pa gnyis ston te /
translated: It teaches the two kinds of divine yogis.

original: gsang ba'i bdag po lha'i gzugs kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gsang ba'i bdag po lha'i gzugs kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Lord of the Secret Ones, the divine form is also of two kinds:

original: yongs su dag pa dang / yongs su ma dag pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa dang / yongs su ma dag pa'o //
translated: purified and unpurified.

original: de la yongs su dag pa ni rtog pa'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: de la yongs su dag pa ni rtog pa'i ngo bo ste /
translated: Among them, the purified is the nature of imagination,

original: mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba'o //
translated: free from all signs.

original: yongs su ma dag pa ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i gzugs te /
analyzed: yongs su ma dag pa ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i gzugs te /
translated: The unpurified is the form with signs,

original: kha dog dang dbyibs so //
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs so //
translated: with color and shape.

original: de la lha'i gzugs rnam pa gnyis kyis bya ba gnyis 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la lha'i gzugs rnam pa gnyis kyis bya ba gnyis 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: Among them, the two kinds of divine form accomplish the two kinds of activities.

original: mtshan ma dang bcas pas ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma dang bcas pas ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa'o //
translated: With signs, it is with signs.

original: mtshan ma med pas ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i dngos grub kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //üîΩmtshan mar bcas pas mtshan bcas kyis //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pas ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i dngos grub kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ro // mtshan mar bcas pas mtshan bcas kyis //
translated: With signlessness, even the attainment with signs occurs.üîΩWith signs, the attainment with signs

original: dngos grub rgyal ba dam pa bzhed //
analyzed: dngos grub rgyal ba dam pa bzhed //
translated: is accepted as the excellent victory.

original: mtshan ma med la gnas pas ni //
analyzed: mtshan ma med la gnas pas ni //
translated: By abiding in signlessness,

original: mtshan ma can yang 'grub tu rung //
analyzed: mtshan ma can yang 'grub tu rung //
translated: even the attainment with signs is possible.

original: de bas rnam pa thams cad du //
analyzed: de bas rnam pa thams cad du //
translated: Therefore, in every way,

original: mtshan ma med pa bsten par bya //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa bsten par bya //
translated: One should rely on the signless.

original: zhes bya ba ste dgongs pas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste dgongs pas bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the interpretable meaning explanation.

original: sbyor ba yan lag drug pa zhes bya ba'i 'grel pa slob dpon chen po zla ba grangs pas mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: sbyor ba yan lag drug pa zhes bya ba'i 'grel pa slob dpon chen po zla ba grangs pas mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the ‚ÄúSix-branch Yoga‚Äù composed by the great master Candragomin is complete.

original: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po a'a rya shradh'a ka ra warmma dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba dge slong rin chen bzang pos bsgyur cing bcos te gtan la phab pa'o /
analyzed: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po a'a rya shradh'a ka ra warmma dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba dge slong rin chen bzang pos bsgyur cing bcos te gtan la phab pa'o /
translated: The Indian preceptor Aryashraddhaka varman and the great editor-translator, the monk Rinchen Zangpo, translated, edited, and finalized this text.
